episodes.title: What Trump's revised travel ban means for refugees
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: President Donald Trump’s revised travel ban says that for 90 days there will be no new visas issued to people from six Muslim-majority countries. No refugees from any country will be allowed into the US for 120 days. What will happen to refugees who have spent years trying to win asylum?

episodes.title: Jeff Sessions's nationalist agenda
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Jeff Sessions and Steve Bannon helped Donald Trump form his nationalist agenda. We look at Sessions’s goals as attorney general, and how he’ll approach them if he survives the investigation into Russian meddling in the election. Also, California is considering providing attorneys for immigrants facing deportation. If passed, it’d be the largest legal defense program for immigrants in the country.

episodes.title: Breaking Point: Housing, density and the future of LA
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Angelenos will vote next week on Measure S, which has stirred up a heated debate: Should LA build higher, denser developments near public transit, or stay as a network of neighborhoods with single family homes and small apartment buildings? Press Play hosts a special broadcast live from Hollywood’s Barnsdall Gallery Theatre, exploring how the housing crisis in LA has caused an identity crisis for Angelenos.

episodes.title: What’s behind the bomb threats to Jewish centers?
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: More than 100 Jewish community centers and schools nationwide have faced bomb threats. The FBI is investigating but so far have not identified a suspect. Also, disgraced lobbyist Jack Abramoff and Congressman Dana Rohrabacher went to Africa to convince leaders there to fight Boko Haram.

episodes.title: Is LA a sanctuary city or not?
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Mayor Eric Garcetti has been cagey about the wording around Los Angeles’ sanctuary status. He’s said LA is a “city of sanctuary.” This has upset some local immigrant rights activists.

episodes.title: Why 'Moonlight's' Oscar win matters
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: There was a lot of confusion onstage Sunday after the envelope mixup that led Faye Dunaway to mistakenly announce “La La Land” as Best Picture. “Moonlight” was the actual winner. Today some people are saying never mind the embarrassing snafu -- “Moonlight’s” win was historic.

episodes.title: Trouble in Anaheim between Latino teens and white law enforcement
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Tuesday night, a white off-duty LAPD officer pulled a gun on Latino teens who had walked on his property in Anaheim. Video of the altercation went viral and sparked outrage in the community.

episodes.title: Protesters face GOP backlash
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: The Arizona state senate has passed a bill that would criminalize certain forms of protest. This comes as angry voters confront Congress members at town hall meetings nationwide. Also, California could become the first state in the union to offer universal single-payer health care. A new bill has been introduced that begins the conversation.

episodes.title: What's the real relationship between immigration and crime?
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: One of Donald Trump’s executive orders states that undocumented immigrants “present a significant threat to national security and public safety.” But years of research paints a more complicated picture. The administration also wants to hire 5,000 new Border Patrol agents and 10,000 new ICE agents, but that comes with myriad challenges.

episodes.title: A sweeping change in immigration policy
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: New memos from the Department of Homeland Security outline the enforcement priorities to address undocumented immigrants crossing the border. They broaden the category of people who are eligible for deportation to practically anyone who doesn’t have papers.

episodes.title: What's the role of leaks in a functional government?
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: What happens to an executive branch when its bureaucrats routinely undermine it? We also speak with local Trump supporters about their reactions to yesterday’s press conference and to the president’s first month in office.

episodes.title: The future of Obamacare, and Democrats' embrace of conspiracy theories
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: House Speaker Paul Ryan says Republicans are ready to introduce their plan to repeal and replace Obamacare. There’s also been an uptick in how many liberals are falling for conspiracy theories in order to explain the Trump administration’s actions.

episodes.title: California lawmakers demand answers on immigration raids
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Local congresswoman Judy Chu says she’s receiving panicked calls from her constituents and no answers from immigration officials about deportations. We also talk about the latest turmoil at the White House.

episodes.title: Mike Flynn's resignation, Barbara Boxer's plan for Democrats
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Michael Flynn resigned as National Security Advisor after he admitted not fully briefing Vice President Mike Pence about his conversations with the Russian ambassador to the US. Also, former Senator Barbara Boxer has a plan to get more Democrats in power.

episodes.title: Oroville dam and fixing infrastructure in California
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Recent storms have put extra pressure on Northern California’s Oroville Dam. Two of the channels that drain the dam are damaged and nearly 200,000 people living downstream have been evacuated. Workers are trying to come up with a fix before more storms move in. We also look at the infrastructure of dams throughout California and some necessary improvements.

episodes.title: Update from Standing Rock, and Governor Brown's environmental record
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: The Trump administration has allowed construction to resume on the Dakota Access Pipeline, so the opposition has asked a court to intervene. A watchdog group has issued California Governor Jerry Brown critical grades on the environment.

episodes.title: Trump's new immigration rules and unconventional phone calls
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: What’s next for the more than a million undocumented estimated to live in LA and Orange Counties? President Trump’s unscripted phone calls with world leaders are making State Department veterans nervous.

episodes.title: Arguments on Trump's travel ban
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Donald Trump’s travel ban on seven Muslim-majority countries -- will the federal government or Washington state prevail? We look at the arguments before the 9th Circuit Court of Appeals.

episodes.title: Trump and taxpayer money
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Donald Trump’s recent trip to Mar-a-Lago and Eric Trump’s trip to Uruguay raise questions of what taxpayers should pay for, as well as the blurred lines between the Trumps’ business holdings and official U.S. business.

episodes.title: Trump’s travel ban hits home
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: A federal judge in Washington State has issued a legal challenge to Donald Trump’s travel ban. Will it hold up in court, and how is the country’s system of checks and balances designed? An LA-based 19-year-old Iraqi student was directly affected by the ban and shares his story. There’s also uncertainty for young Mexican immigrants brought to the U.S. as young children, who have been protected under Obama’s DACA program.

episodes.title: The threat to Dodd-Frank and the rise of Snapchat
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: President Trump says he wants to get rid of Dodd-Frank, the legislation reining in big banks. We talk about what that would do to the economy and consumers. Snapchat’s parent company has filed for a $3 billion dollar IPO, reportedly the largest ever for a company based in Los Angeles.

episodes.title: Steve Bannon's America, free speech, and the refugee experience
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: White House Chief Strategist Steve Bannon is behind many of Donald Trump’s policies, including the recent travel ban on people from seven Muslim-majority countries. Protests over Milo Yiannopoulos are stirring up conversations around free speech v. hate speech. And Pulitzer Prize winner Viet Thanh Nguyen shares his new short story collection “The Refugees.”

episodes.title: Supreme Court reform and California as a sanctuary state
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Democrats and Republicans are sparring over the nomination of Neil Gorsuch as the next Supreme Court justice. But what if the real problem is the structure of the Supreme Court itself? Also, California is debating becoming a sanctuary state. Is that necessary to protect immigrants or unnecessarily provocative?

episodes.title: Trump's parallels with Nixon, and the growing fight against Trump's travel ban
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: After President Trump ordered to bar people from seven predominantly Muslim countries from entering the US, some travelers were detained at airports over the weekend. Silicon Valley is also worried about how this will affect their workers, may who are foreign-born and rely on H-1B visas. Also, might Trump be repeating some of Richard Nixon’s mistakes?

episodes.title: The immigration ban fallout
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Protests erupted nationwide over President Donald Trump’s executive order banning people from seven majority-Muslim countries from entering the U.S. We discuss it with California Senator Kamala Harris, and learn about one of the architects of the ban.

episodes.title: Sanctuary city laws and a new college master plan
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: We look at whether the federal government can take money away from states and cities that protect undocumented immigrants. Also, a new report says public higher education in California can be almost free.

episodes.title: The changing US-Mexico relationship
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: A meeting between Mexico’s president and Donald Trump is cancelled over disagreements on who will pay for Trump’s border wall. But there may be more similarities than differences between the two leaders.

episodes.title: Gags on scientists, executive orders on immigration
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: The Badlands National Park Twitter account was scrubbed of tweets mentioning climate change, and the EPA and USDA are also grappling with new climate directives. President Trump is also interested in reviving the so-called CIA black sites abroad to hold terrorism suspects, and signed executive orders on the US-Mexico border wall and sanctuary cities.

episodes.title: The state of California: Not enough money, so what's getting cut?
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: In his annual State of the State address, Governor Jerry Brown talked about ways California will resist President Trump’s agenda. He did not mention the state’s projected $1.6 billion budget deficit. We get a debrief of Brown’s address and his budget proposal.

episodes.title: Where does the women's movement go from here?
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Millions worldwide attended women’s marches on Saturday. Longtime protester Dolores Huerta has advice for younger activists. We speak with a march leader, along with an anti-abortion activist who attended the event in DC. Also, how effective have mass demonstrations been throughout history?

episodes.title: California under Trump: The next four years
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: On the inauguration day of Donald Trump, Press Play hosts a special live call-in show.

episodes.title: Can California's environmental regulations withstand Trump?
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: The state has imposed strict emissions standards on the auto industry, but that may be in jeopardy with the incoming Trump administration.

episodes.title: Trump's cabinet and the privatization of government
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: We look at what the cabinet secretary hearings have revealed in terms of the new administration’s philosophy.

episodes.title: Concerns over Labor and Interior department nominees
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Labor Secretary nominee Andy Puzder’s Senate confirmation was expected to take place this week, but it’s on hold.

episodes.title: A celebration of African American life and culture
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: In this special Martin Luther King, Jr. Day broadcast, we look at the drama behind building the African American museum in Washington DC. The novel “Homegoing” traces longstanding trauma of the slave trade. The hip hop group A Tribe Called Quest released a new album after 18 years of silence. And the book “Black Faces, White Spaces” explores the relationship between blacks and the outdoors.

episodes.title: Senate confirmations, contradictions and the beginning of the end of Obamacare
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: It’s been a busy week in Washington. There were the confirmation hearings, Donald Trump’s first press conference since the election, the Senate’s move to unravel Obamacare, and a big policy change on Cuban migrants.

episodes.title: Ben Carson and Mike Pompeo face confirmation hearings
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Ben Carson has no experience running a government agency, but it looks like he will soon head the $47 billion Department of Housing and Urban Development. Also today, Donald Trump’s nominee for CIA director was questioned on his views on torture.

episodes.title: Donald Trump on Russia, ethics, and the dossier
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: During Donald Trump’s first press conference as president-elect, he answered questions about Russia, his business interests, and Obamacare. But the story grabbing all the headlines right now is about a dossier alleging the Russians have dirt on Trump and are blackmailing him with it.

episodes.title: Jeff Sessions' track record: War on Drugs, immigration
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Senator Jeff Sessions faced tough questions at his confirmation hearing for Attorney General. We talk about his record on the War on Drugs, what it would mean for legal marijuana use in California, and what he might do about undocumented immigrants.

episodes.title: Is Hollywood out of touch with Trump's America?
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: We look at last night’s Golden Globes -- the awards, speeches, and whether they reflect America. We also look at whether Donald Trump has kept good on his promise to make America great again by bringing back manufacturing jobs.

episodes.title: Will the Pineapple Express end California's drought?
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: California is facing a major storm this weekend and another next week. We expect to get six feet of snow and 12 inches of rain. Even with the storms, Santa Barbara’s main source of water is in trouble.

episodes.title: What's the future of US intelligence gathering?
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: There are 17 intelligence agencies. We examine what they all do, and find out what the rift with Donald Trump over their assessment of Russian hacking will mean for intelligence gathering in the future.

episodes.title: Julian Assange as a right-wing hero, and Steve Mnuchin's ties to foreclosures
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: We look at how Wikileaks founder Julian Assange went from villain to hero for Donald Trump and his supporters. Also, Trump’s Treasury Secretary pick ran a bank that allegedly broke state foreclosure laws.

episodes.title: Race, religion, gay rights and the new Republican Congress
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Sen. Jeff Sessions was once denied a federal judgeship because of alleged racism. Will that matter when lawmakers hold confirmation hearings? The idea of religious freedom is being used to introduce legislation that is seen as anti-gay rights. Remembering John Berger, who died at 90 after decades of teaching generations to see art differently. A new book shows the before and after of Japanese American internment camps.

episodes.title: Awards season, and the best movies of 2016
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: For a special holiday show, Press Play talks about the significance of movie awards, and we revisit some of our best film interviews of 2016.

episodes.title: How a trade war with China could hurt California
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Donald Trump is talking about a 45 percent tariff on imported goods from China, and he’s picked a China hardliner to run the National Trade Council. How will that affect California’s tech, film and food products? Also, the town of Clovis won $22 million in a case against Shell. And we learn why some rural men who identify as straight are having sex with each other.

episodes.title: California vows to defend undocumented immigrants
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: The city has earmarked $10 million to defend undocumented immigrants from deportation. We hear how that’s going to work, and get an overview of new state laws. And we get a visit from Santa Claus.

episodes.title: Photo of an assassination raises ethical questions
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: An AP photo of the gunman in Turkey who shot the Russian ambassador was splashed across newspapers and screens. What does this say about the images we see now, and whether they can affect public opinion about conflict?

episodes.title: Electoral College drama and American meddling in elections abroad
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: We look at past elections where the popular vote went against the Electoral College, plus America’s record of interfering in other countries’ elections.

episodes.title: Weekend films and the Hispanic media landscape
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: In an abbreviated Press Play, we look at this weekend’s theatrical releases and a new Netflix biopic of Barack Obama, as well as developments in the Hispanic media landscape.

episodes.title: What will happen to health care under Trump?
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Californians are concerned about health care as a Republican Congress and new president vow to repeal Obamacare. What are Republicans’ plans beyond that, and would Democrats support them? We also hear from the chairman of the Standing Rock Sioux tribe about what’s next for the Dakota Access Pipeline.

episodes.title: Tech companies: meeting with Trump, fighting fake news
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: The leaders of Amazon, Microsoft and other tech companies met with Donald Trump today. Another issue facing tech firms is fake news.

episodes.title: The future of US energy policy and Arctic drilling
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Donald Trump has named former Texas Governor Rick Perry to head the Department of Energy. Perry once wanted to get rid of that department entirely. Rex Tillerson is Trump’s nominee to run the State Department. As CEO of Exxon, Tillerson formed a partnership with Russia’s state-owned oil company to explore oil in the Arctic.

episodes.title: Where do US intelligence and the GOP stand on Russia?
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: The CIA says Russia meddled in the US election to help Donald Trump win. The FBI was reluctant to agree with the CIA on Russia’s motives. With Donald Trump cozying up to Russia, the Republican Party is split.

episodes.title: The vanishing American dream and the moral responsibility of tech companies
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: A new study finds that the opportunities are vanishing for millennials to do better economically than their parents. Jobs are being replaced by automation, so what does Silicon Valley owe workers its technology replaces?

episodes.title: Trump’s EPA pick and consequences for California
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Donald Trump picks a climate change denier and opponent of federal environmental rules to head the Environmental Protection Agency. What will California do to protect its air and water from what will likely be a loosening of federal rules?

episodes.title: Abortion in the age of Trump
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: The Ohio legislature passed a bill that essentially bans abortions. It says makes abortion illegal once a fetal heartbeat can be detected. We talk about that bill and other anti-abortion laws being challenged nationwide.

episodes.title: How California Democrats are taking on Trump
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: The new California legislature, with its Democratic super majority, has outlined a confrontational agenda with Donald Trump.

episodes.title: In the wake of the Oakland 'Ghost Ship' fire, what happens next?
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: An Oakland warehouse fire claimed at least three dozen lives this weekend. The fire broke out Friday night during a concert at a building which housed artists’ studios and living spaces.

episodes.title: Life in San Bernardino, one year after the terrorist attack
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: A year ago today, terrorists walked into an office building in San Bernardino and killed 14 people. We look at the last year in San Bernardino, which is now one of the most violent cities in the nation.

episodes.title: California's new attorney general and the state's opposition to Trump
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: California Governor Jerry Brown has picked Congressman Xavier Becerra for the state’s open attorney general seat. The position may gain national attention as state lawmakers pledge to fight the incoming Trump administration on several fronts.

episodes.title: What happens to Black Lives Matter during the Trump era?
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: We look at the decision not to file charges in the police shooting death of Keith Scott, and how that fits into the larger Black Lives Matter movement. Also, can immigrants facing deportation be held indefinitely or should they be able to post bail?

episodes.title: Peter Thiel's ambitions, and tradeoffs of the gig economy
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Silicon Valley billionaire Peter Thiel went against his industry by supporting Donald Trump. Now he’s part of the president-elect’s transition team. Also, temporary work without benefits accounted for all net job growth from 2005 to 2015, and most of those jobs went to middle-aged workers.

episodes.title: Is an election recount a good idea?
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: The Green Party’s Jill Stein is pushing for election recounts in three battleground states. Why and what could come of the effort? Also, a peek into the business of fake news.

episodes.title: Defining the 'alt-right,' and how teachers explain politics
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: There’s been a lot of discussion about the term “alt-right,” and some say journalists shouldn’t use the term because it disguises the true nature of who’s behind it. Two Los Angeles teachers share how they’re helping their students navigate life after the election.

episodes.title: Donald Trump's conflicts of interest, and the post-9/11 Muslim registry
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Ethical questions are being raised about President-elect Donald Trump’s business interests. He’s also talked about implementing a registry for some Muslim immigrants, something that was done after 9/11 with the so-called NSEERS program.

episodes.title: Identity politics and the future of the Democratic Party
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Bernie Sanders urged his supporters yesterday to move away from identity politics, but others say that’s a call to ignore racism, sexism and other forms of bigotry. Identity politics will be key to the future of the Democratic party.

episodes.title: Trump’s picks for Attorney General, CIA Director and national security advisor
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: President-elect Donald Trump has selected Jeff Sessions as Attorney General, Mike Pompeo as CIA Director, and Michael Flynn as national security advisor. What you need to know about these men.

episodes.title: Dreamers and Deportation in the age of Trump
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Donald Trump has promised to rescind President Obama’s Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program, which gives temporary legal status to so-called Dreamers. Trump also cited the Eisenhower era’s Operation Wetback as a model for his deportation plans. Civil rights groups hold up that 1950s approach as an example of ethnic profiling.

episodes.title: Gimme Shelter: Housing the Homeless in LA
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: A special live broadcast of Press Play examines the city’s unprecedented homeless crisis from how we got here to what the solutions might be.

episodes.title: Manufacturing and coal aren't coming back
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Manufacturing and coal industries in the US have been hit hard over the past few years. Donald Trump has promised to revive them, but some say that’s unlikely.

episodes.title: Trump presidency: His son-in-law's role, and the media
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Ivanka Trump’s husband, Jared Kushner, is working on Donald Trump’s transition team. He comes from a real estate family whose fortune was built by his controversial father. How will he shape the Trump administration?

episodes.title: Steve Bannon, the Electoral College, and wisdom from an imam
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: The incoming White House chief strategist used to head Breitbart News. Critics call Stephen Bannon racist, sexist and anti-semitic -- based on stories he published there.

episodes.title: The future of healthcare and fighting veteran homelessness
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: President-elect Donald Trump wants to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act, which has sent many Americans scrambling for answers on what can really happen. Also on this Veterans Day, we look at L.A.’s efforts to house every homeless vet.

episodes.title: Donald Trump's cabinet, climate policy and executive power
episodes.author: KCRW, KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Rumors are flying that Donald Trump’s top campaign advisors will fill his cabinet. A climate change skeptic might head the Environmental Protection Agency. The president-elect also wants to undo all of President Obama’s executive orders.

episodes.title: Your questions about how Trump won, what it means, what's next
episodes.author: KCRW, KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: After a historic and stunning presidential election, we want to hear from you. We’ll take your questions and comments live on air starting at 12pm PST.

episodes.title: Watching results, texts to boost turnout, and “I voted” stickers
episodes.author: KCRW, KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: A guide on what to watch for and when as the polls close around the country. Also, Vote.org has been trying to get people to vote by texting them. And what’s the story behind those “I voted” stickers?

episodes.title: The importance of Florida and fact-checking
episodes.author: KCRW, KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Florida has been a central focus for presidential campaigns ever since it put George W. Bush in the White House with a margin of 537 votes. Donald Trump, Hillary Clinton and their surrogates have been crisscrossing the state in the last few days. Also, researchers have debunked a widely-cited study that says correcting someone with facts reinforces their erroneous belief.

episodes.title: How California’s ‘tough on crime’ narrative is on the ballot
episodes.author: KCRW, KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Both Prop 57 and 64 play into a broader narrative in California over the past few years that “tough on crime” may be too tough.

episodes.title: Concerns around voter intimidation and Brexit
episodes.author: KCRW, KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Groups supporting Trump say they plan to send poll watchers to polling places nationwide on election day. The groups say they want to prevent voter fraud, but opponents argue that what they’re doing is voter intimidation.

episodes.title: Police drama, on and offscreen
episodes.author: KCRW, KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: The LA County Sheriff’s Department is getting a civilian oversight committee for the first time. The department has been plagued by scandal. Sheriffs have been convicted of assault and misconduct inside county jails, and former undersheriff Paul Tanaka was convicted of obstructing an FBI investigation into that abuse.

episodes.title: Why some cities are preemptively banning recreational pot
episodes.author: KCRW, KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Prop 64 would legalize recreational marijuana statewide, and cities could make their own rules around the growth, sale and use of weed. But California cities are pre-emptively banning the sale of recreational pot until they can figure out what they want to do locally.

episodes.title: Debating development in South LA and exploring LA's haunted past
episodes.author: KCRW, KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: A new, giant development proposed for South LA is dividing the community. Some see The Reef as an opportunity to breath new life into an underserved community. But others see it as a harbinger of gentrification.

episodes.title: Protests at the Dakota Access Pipeline heat up
episodes.author: KCRW, KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: The Standing Rock Sioux tribe and their supporters have been camping at the Dakota Access Pipeline for months to protest it. But yesterday turned violent, and than 140 people were arrested.

episodes.title: How long can the Supreme Court go without 9 justices?
episodes.author: KCRW, KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: The Supreme Court has been short a justice since Antonin Scalia died in February. While Senator John McCain later walked that statement back, Senator Ted Cruz raised the prospect of Republicans fighting to keep the seat vacant.

episodes.title: First American wins Man Booker Prize for satirizing race in LA
episodes.author: KCRW, KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Los Angeles-born writer Paul Beatty is the first American to win the Man Booker Prize for Fiction. He won for The Sellout, a satire based in south LA. It’s laced with cutting insights on race, slavery, Oreo cookies and segregation.

episodes.title: An election season worth billions. Where’s all the money going?
episodes.author: KCRW, KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: An unprecedented amount of money has flooded into campaign coffers this year. President Obama tapped Hollywood elites on behalf of the Democratic party last night. But where, exactly, is that money going? And what are the rules for how it can be used?

episodes.title: One year since the Porter Ranch gas leak, what’s changed?
episodes.author: KCRW, KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: The leak at Aliso Canyon was the worst natural gas leak in American history. One year later, residents of Porter Ranch have returned to their homes and the federal government is taking a closer look at other gas storage facilities across the nation.

episodes.title: Surviving capture in Syria
episodes.author: KCRW, KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Among the casualties of the Syrian civil war are several journalists who were captured by militants. Theo Padnos was captured in 2012 in Syria. After nearly two years of imprisonment and torture, Padnos was freed. A new documentary, Theo Who Lived, tells his story.

episodes.title: What will happen in Congress after the election?
episodes.author: KCRW, KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Depending on what happens Nov. 8, we look at future possibilities for the makeup of the House and Senate. Also, who is Evan McMullin and why is he out-polling Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump in Utah?

episodes.title: The rise of hate and the right wing
episodes.author: KCRW, KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Inflammatory and hateful rhetoric targeted at undocumented immigrants is on the rise this election season. After Univision anchor Jorge Ramos, a U.S. citizen, was thrown out of a Donald Trump press conference and told to go back to Mexico, he decided to make a film called Hate Rising.

episodes.title: Dueling dispensary owners on Prop 64 and legalizing pot
episodes.author: KCRW, KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Proposition 64 would legalize recreational marijuana in California for people over the age of 21. But marijuana dispensary owners are split over whether or not to support the ballot initiative.

episodes.title: Rigged! Donald Trump vs the media
episodes.author: KCRW, KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump has repeatedly called this election “rigged” and said that voter fraud is widespread. There is no evidence to support either claim, but the declarations could have a lasting, deleterious effect.

episodes.title: Mayor Garcetti on the future of LA development
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Mayor Eric Garcetti weighs in on the future of development in Los Angeles and how he plans to house more people who are currently homeless. And when it comes to LA sports, the Dodgers are up and the Rams are...kind of up.

episodes.title: Defending Bob Dylan and generation Adderall
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Bob Dylan was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature today to the surprise of many Nobel watchers. And with less than month to go before the election, how are Bernie Sanders supporters feeling?

episodes.title: LAPD called on to be more transparent in handling officer-involved shootings
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: The Los Angeles Police Commission is recommending more transparency in how the LAPD handles officer-involved shootings. What are they calling for, why and what is the reaction?

episodes.title: Are Russian hackers leaking false stories to sway the US election?
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: The second presidential debate had a lot of voters wondering who Sidney Blumenthal is. Donald Trump is repeating a false story that links Blumenthal to Benghazi, which journalist Kurt Eichenwald says began when Russian hackers attributed his writing to Blumenthal.

episodes.title: Presidential politics and Syria, and sexual assault survivors speak out
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: One day after the second presidential debate, an examination of where each candidate stands on Syria. And a leaked tape of Donald Trump bragging about kissing and groping women without their consent has inspired thousands of women to share their stories of sexual assault on social media.

episodes.title: Colombian President receives Nobel Prize for peace effort with FARC
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: Colombian President Juan Manuel Santos has been awarded the Nobel Peace Prize, just days after Colombian voters rejected a peace deal he had been negotiating with FARC rebels to end 52 years of conflict.

episodes.title: Photographer captures dramatic images of migrants rescued at sea
episodes.author: KCRW, Madeleine Brand
episodes.summary: More than 11,000 African migrants were rescued trying to cross the Mediterranean this week. A photographer on one of the boats off Libya’s coast captured a dramatic rescue.
